alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Dickenson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 7:09PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of far northern Dickenson, Buchanan, McDowell, far southern Raleigh and southern Wyoming Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 708 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mullens to Elkhorn City. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Welch, Grundy, Pineville, Breaks Interstate, Mullens, Gary, War, Northfork, Hanover, Big Rock, Paw Paw, Gilbert Creek, Davy, Bradshaw, Iaeger, Keystone, Anawalt, Kimball, Jolo and Elbert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Charleston West Virginia. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southern and southeastern West Virginia.
